arts.ttl: Serie A | Genoa 1-1 Como: Match Report
arts.sum: In a dramatic encounter, Genoa managed to secure a last-minute equalizer against Como, thanks to Alessandro Vogliacco’s timely goal, denying Como a well-deserved victory. The match showcased the immense talent of Nico Paz, whose contributions were overshadowed by the late heroics of Vogliacco, leaving Genoa with an unexpected point. Como took the lead in the first half through Lucas Da Cunha, whose left-footed strike found the back of the net after a well-executed play. The goal came after Genoa struggled to maintain possession and failed to capitalize on their chances. arts.ttl: Genoa vs. Como kicks off matchday 12
arts.sum: Genoa and Como will meet in Serie A 42 years and 280 days after their previous meeting (a 1-0 home win for the Rossoblù in January 1982); the Grifone are unbeaten in five of their six matches against the Lariani in the competition (W3 D2). Genoa have scored the highest share of their Serie A goals in the final 15 minutes of games this season (5/8 from 76` onwards, 62.5%), while Como have conceded eight goals in this period: at least two more than any other side in the top-flight in 2024/25.

Genoa are coming off a huge 1-0 win in Parma that moved them out of the relegation zone on Monday. Como have lost four of their last five matches after conceding a 1-0 defeat to Empoli earlier this w...

arts.ttl: Fabregas confident ahead of Genoa clash: “United, we will go a long way”
arts.sum: On the eve of Como’s match against Genoa, head coach Cesc Fabregas addressed the media in a pre-match press conference, expressing confidence in his team’s ability to overcome challenges and discussing the current injury situation. Fabregas began by acknowledging the strength of their opponents: “Genoa is coming off a victory and will now play at home, so they’ll have confidence. They attack with many players, are very offensive, and play vertically a lot. They’re trying to emerge from a difficult moment, and in front of their fans, they’ll certainly want to perform well.” Despite the challenges, the Spanish coach remained The post Fabregas confident ahead of Genoa clash: “United, we will go a long way” appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Serie A | Genoa v Como: Match Preview
arts.sum: Struggling Genoa and Como meet at the Stadio Luigi Ferraris on Thursday evening in a crucial Serie A clash. Genoa recently secured their second league win of the season with a late goal, while Como continued to falter, suffering their fourth defeat in five matches. The Grifone faced Parma in a tense encounter last Monday night, with both teams desperate for a win after failing to secure three points since August.
